The euler angles for this system should be set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the translation vector should be set to [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. This will position and orient the part correctly in the overall assembly. Create the Sketch Next, create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. This sketch should contain a single face (face_1). The face_1 should have a loop (loop_1) consisting of 4 lines (line_1, line_2, line_3, line_4). The start and end points for these lines are as follows: * line\\_1: [0.0, 0.0], [0.7371, 0.0] * line\\_2: [0.7371, 0.0], [0.7371, 0.6669] * line\\_3: [0.7371, 0.6669], [0.0, 0.6669] * line\\_4: [0.0, 0.6669], [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the Sketch Now, extrude the sketch along the normal by a distance of 0.75 units. Set the sketch scale parameter to 0.7371. The extrusion operation for part 1 is a "NewBodyFeatureOperation", meaning it will create a new solid body in the overall assembly. The dimensions of the extruded shape are 0.7371 units in length, width and height. Part 2 Instructions Create the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 2. The euler angles for this system should be set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] degrees and the translation vector should be set to [0.1221, 0.1222, 0.6669]. This will position and orient the part correctly in the overall assembly. Create the Sketch Next, create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. This sketch should contain a single face (face_1). The face_1 should have a loop (loop_1) consisting of a single circle (circle_1). The center and radius for the circle are as follows: * circle\\_1: [0.2441, 0.2441], 0.2441 Extrude the Sketch Now, extrude the sketch along the opposite direction of normal by a distance of 0.2953 units. Set the sketch scale parameter to 0.4881. The extrusion operation for part 2 is a "CutFeatureOperation", meaning it will remove material from the existing solid body in the overall assembly. The dimensions of the shaped after the cut is 0.4881 units in length and width, and 0.2953 units in height.</description>
